Posts.Content: Thank you for replying to me. My angiosarcoma was radiation induced from an earlier 1996 cancer of same breast. A lumpectomy was done at that time with 5 weeks radiation. Cancer at that time was inductal carcinoma insitu, no nodes involved. Very early cancer. I feel if I had not had the radiation I would not have this cancer now. I am to have a cat scan April 30, and will receive results May 2. If it is cancer I understand the surgeon will be excise the nodule. What is a re resection and is irridation the same as radiation? Thank you.
Posts.Title: Angiosarcoma of the breast

Posts.Content: Wow you certainly were put thru the wringer so to speak. So happy you are okay. I found a very large lump in L breast. Bruising too. Had a mammogram, followed by biopsy. 2 weeks later results said NO cancer. Benign fibroid with inflammation. However, Dr. not happy so sent me to Cancer Clinic for a further biopsy. Another biopsy done. 2 weeks later I was diagnosed with angiosarcoma. I had a radical mastectomy within 2 weeks. After healing I had chemo (doxirubicin and Isophamide). I went into hospital every 3 weeks and my chemo was intraveniously induced for 37.5 hours. It was very aggressive chemo. I had 5 treatments. My oncologist cancelled the 6th, said my body couldn't take any more. I then had a blood transfusion. After that it was a case of recuperation. All that was in 2006/07. In March of this year I had a DIEP reconstruction done. I am still sort of recuperating from this extensive surgery. Sorry for the delay in replying. I hope by now you are doing well and are a survivor. God Bless
Posts.Title: Angiosarcoma of the breast

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with angiosarcoma of breast last August. Had a simple mastectomy Septmber, followed by extensive chemo. Now 8 months later I may have a recurrence in the site. Is there anyone out there who is a survivor of this disease? I am a 59 year old female. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Angiosarcoma of the breast

Posts.Content: On 4/17/2007 Babyboomer59 wrote: Thank you for replying to me. My angiosarcoma was radiation induced from an earlier 1996 cancer of same breast. A lumpectomy was done at that time with 5 weeks radiation. Cancer at that time was inductal carcinoma insitu, no nodes involved. Very early cancer. I feel if I had not had the radiation I would not have this cancer now. I am to have a cat scan April 30, and will receive results May 2. If it is cancer I understand the surgeon will be excise the nodule. What is a re resection and is irridation the same as radiation? Thank you. Just to let everyone know that my resection was done and all the lumps were benign. It is now April 30, 2008 and I have just had my 6 monthly check up, X-Ray and physical by oncologist. Everything is good. I feel good. Am trying to exercise more than I usually do. Eat right. By the grace of the good Lord I feel like I have beaten this very rare form of cancer. Every day is a blessing. If there is anyone out there who has been diagnosed with this very rare form of cancer, believe, hope and pray. I AM A SURVIVOR FOR THE 2ND TIME. God Bless you all.
Posts.Title: Angiosarcoma of the breast

Posts.Content: On 10/13/2003 elaine r. wrote: Hi Lisa I had a mastecomy and I am going every 3 mos for cat scans. So far I have been lucky. I was told in my case radiation or chemo is not effective. I wish your daughter well.
Posts.Title: Angiosarcoma

Posts.Content: Hello, I had cancer in 1996 which recurrence again in 2006. I had a radical mastectomy. On March 23, 09 I had a DIEP reconstruction done. I have healed quite well but am concerned about hard lumps now appearing along my abdominal scar line. I also have a large hard lump in my reconstructed breast. Is there anyone who has had DIEP reconstructed with these side effects. I do understand that it may be just fatty tissue, however, sometimes I wonder? Help? Daffodil
Posts.Title: DIEP reconstruction after radical mastectomy
